meanings.definition: An individual, item, or part considered typical of a group, class, or whole.
meanings.sent1: This specimen of a flower is a perfect example of its kind.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the specimen of rock to learn more about its composition.
meanings.sent3: The teacher held up the specimen of a leaf and pretended it was a superhero cape.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a rare specimen in a world full of selfishness.
meanings.sent5: The specimen of a starfish in the aquarium was so vibrant and fascinating.

meanings.definition: A sample or example used for analysis or study.
meanings.sent1: The doctor collected a specimen of blood for testing.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologist carefully labeled each specimen of pottery found at the site.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally dropped the specimen of sauce on the floor, creating a messy situation.
meanings.sent4: His speech was a specimen of eloquence that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The specimen of bacteria under the microscope wriggled and multiplied, revealing its nature.
